title: Bisequent Calculi for Neutral Free Logic with Definite Descriptions
abstract:
We present a bisequent calculus (BSC) for the minimal theory of definite
descriptions (DD) in the setting of neutral free logic, where formulae with
non-denoting terms have no truth value. The treatment of quantifiers, atomic
formulae and simple terms is based on the approach developed by Pavlovi\'{c}
and Gratzl. We extend their results to the version with identity and definite
descriptions. In particular, the admissibility of cut is proven for this
extended system.
